name: Balgruuf the Greater

aspects.high_concept: Jarl of Whiterun Torn Between Empire and Stormcloaks
aspects.trouble: Strains of Neutrality â€“ Under Pressure from All Sides
other_aspects: Determined to Protect his Hold from Dragons and War
Honorable Nord with a Pragmatic Streak

stunts: Voice of Authority: +2 to Rapport when giving orders or resolving disputes among his subjects.
Steadfast Ruler: +2 to Will when resisting intimidation or political pressure from either Imperials or Stormcloaks.

trust_clock.description: Measures Jarl Balgruuf's trust in the party based on their actions in Whiterun Hold.

relationships.Imperial Legion: Owes allegiance (leaning Imperial, though officially neutral)
relationships.Stormcloaks: Potential adversaries (he's wary of their cause)
relationships.Gray-Mane Clan: Respected citizens, but disagrees with their Stormcloak sympathies
relationships.Battle-Born Clan: Close allies in city politics (pro-Imperial family)

personality_notes.speaking_style: Gravelly and authoritative, yet with warmth when speaking to his people. Balgruuf balances firmness with a fatherly concern.
motivations: Protect Whiterun and its people from any threat (dragons or war)
Maintain stability and neutrality as long as possible
Fulfill his duties honorably as a Nord Jarl while keeping Skyrim intact
fears: Whiterun falling to chaos or being destroyed (by war or dragons)
Being forced into a civil war choice that tears his hold apart
Failing his people or losing their trust
quirks: Often drums his fingers on the armrest of his throne when deep in thought
Shows genuine concern for even the least of his subjects
Can be surprisingly frank and direct, even to powerful figures

combat_tactics: Balgruuf typically avoids direct combat, delegating to Irileth and his guards. If forced to fight (such as during a dragon attack or siege), he wades in with a one-handed axe and shield, fighting defensively. He prioritizes protecting civilians and rallying his men over chasing glory.
scene_triggers: Dragon Rising (first dragon encounter at the Western Watchtower)
Civil War negotiations or the moment Whiterun must choose a side
Audience with the Jarl (any time the party seeks council in Dragonsreach)
